channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: LA Mayor Bass delays Palisades fire report at DOJ’s request amid probe
item.description: LA Mayor Karen Bass holds back Palisades fire after-action report amid federal investigation, drawing criticism from community groups seeking answers.

item.title: KBJ Could Learn A Few Lessons On ‘Professionalism’ From Justice Barrett
item.description: Jackson would be wise to follow Barrett's example in demonstrating how judges are supposed to conduct themselves.

item.title: Irish Too Good to Serve Each Other
item.description: What would it mean as a policy for Irish people to expect that the bottom 10 percent of jobs be taken up by immigrants?

item.title: Trump’s Just War Against University Antisemitism Can Go Too Far
item.description: The Trump administration’s case against UCLA shows the danger of hostile environment claims.

item.title: The Return of Car Choice, Hopefully
item.description: Whatever happens to the future of EVs, they should compete on an even playing field with other vehicles.

item.title: Suspended Time: A Privileged History of Covid
item.description: Gatekeepers and the media elite sentimentalize the memory of the lockdowns.

item.title: Trump slams mail-in ballots as corrupt, but may not have the power to derail them
item.description: Trump, citing Putin, vowed to end mail-in ballots with an executive order, despite both the facts and the Constitution’s limits on his power.

item.title: Trump Has No Power to Tell States How to Conduct Elections
item.description: While Congress may override state election regulations, the president has no such power.

item.title: Trump Ending Wars Is Wonderful, But Only One Thing Can Get Him Into Heaven
item.description: Trump may have been joking, but it bears repeating: None of your own works, not even saving lives, can earn you a spot in paradise.
